propComponents.name: Wizard
propComponents.description:
Wrapper for all steps and hosts state, including navigation helpers, within context.
The WizardContext provided by default gives any child of wizard access to those resources.

props.name: children
props.description: Step components

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes spread to the wizard

props.name: footer
props.description: Wizard footer

props.name: header
props.description: Wizard header

props.name: height
props.description: Custom height of the wizard

props.name: isProgressive
props.description: Progressively shows steps, where all steps following the active step are hidden. Defaults to false.

props.name: isVisitRequired
props.description: Disables steps that haven't been visited. Defaults to false.

props.name: nav
props.description: Wizard navigation

props.name: navAriaLabel
props.description: Aria-label for the Nav

props.name: onClose
props.description: Callback function to close the wizard

props.name: onSave
props.description: Callback function to save at the end of the wizard, if not specified uses onClose

props.name: onStepChange
props.type:
(
  event: React.MouseEvent<HTMLButtonElement>,
  currentStep: WizardStepType,
  prevStep: WizardStepType,
  scope: WizardStepChangeScope
) => void | Promise<void>
props.description: Callback function when navigating between steps

props.name: shouldFocusContent
props.description:
Flag indicating whether the wizard content should be focused after the onNext or onBack callbacks
are called.

props.name: startIndex
props.description: The initial index the wizard is to start on (1 or higher). Defaults to 1.

props.name: width
props.description: Custom width of the wizard

propComponents.name: WizardFooter
propComponents.description: Hosts the standard structure of a footer with ties to the active step so that text for buttons can vary from step to step.

Adds an accessible name to the wrapper element by passing the the id of one or more elements.
The aria-labelledby will only be applied when the content overflows and renders a scrollbar.

propComponents.name: TreeView
propComponents.description: The main tree view component.

props.name: activeItems
props.description: Active items of tree view.

props.name: allExpanded
props.description:
Sets the expanded state on all tree nodes, overriding default behavior and current
internal state.

props.name: aria-label
props.description:
A text string that sets the accessible name of the tree view list. Either this or the aria-labelledby property must
be passed in.

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description:
A space separated list of element id's that sets the accessible name of the tree view list. Either
this or the aria-label property must be passed in.

props.name: className
props.description: Class to add if not passed a parentItem property.

props.name: compareItems
props.description: Comparison function for determining active items.

props.name: data
props.description: Data of the tree view.

props.name: defaultAllExpanded
props.description: Sets the default expanded behavior.

props.name: expandedIcon
props.description: Icon for all expanded node items.

props.name: hasBadges
props.description: Flag indicating if all nodes in the tree view should have badges.

props.name: hasCheckboxes
props.description: Flag indicating if all nodes in the tree view should have checkboxes.

props.name: hasGuides
props.description: Flag indicating if the tree view has guide lines.

props.name: hasSelectableNodes
props.description:
Flag indicating that tree nodes should be independently selectable, even when having
children.

props.name: icon
props.description: Icon for all leaf or unexpanded node items.

props.name: id
props.description: ID of the tree view.

props.name: isMultiSelectable
props.description:
Flag indicating whether multiple nodes can be selected in the tree view. This will also set the
aria-multiselectable attribute on the tree view list which is required to be true when multiple selection is intended.
Can only be applied to the root tree view list.

props.name: isNested
props.description: Flag indicating if the tree view is nested.

props.type: (event: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>, item: TreeViewDataItem, parentItem: TreeViewDataItem) => void
props.description: Callback for item checkbox selection.

props.name: onCollapse
props.type: (event: React.MouseEvent, item: TreeViewDataItem, parentItem: TreeViewDataItem) => void
props.description: Callback for collapsing a node with children.

props.name: onExpand
props.type: (event: React.MouseEvent, item: TreeViewDataItem, parentItem: TreeViewDataItem) => void
props.description: Callback for expanding a node with children.

props.name: onSelect
props.type: (event: React.MouseEvent, item: TreeViewDataItem, parentItem: TreeViewDataItem) => void
props.description: Callback for item selection.

props.name: parentItem
props.description: Internal. Parent item of a tree view list item.

props.name: toolbar
props.description: Toolbar to display above the tree view.

props.name: useMemo
props.description:
Flag indicating the tree view should utilize memoization to help render large data sets.
Setting this property requires that the activeItems property is passed an array containing
every node in the selected item's path.

props.name: variant
props.description: Variant presentation styles for the tree view.

propComponents.name: TreeViewDataItem
propComponents.description:
Properties that make up a tree view data item. These properties should be passed in as an
object to one of the various tree view component properties which accept TreeViewDataItem as
a type.

props.name: action
props.description: Action of a tree view item, which can be either a button or dropdown component.

props.name: badgeProps
props.description: Additional properties of the tree view item badge.

props.name: checkProps
props.description: Additional properties of the tree view item checkbox.

props.name: children
props.description: Child nodes of a tree view item.

props.name: customBadgeContent
props.description: Optional prop for a custom badge.

props.name: defaultExpanded
props.description: Flag indicating if node is expanded by default.

props.name: expandedIcon
props.description: Expanded icon of a tree view item.

props.name: hasBadge
props.description: Flag indicating if a tree view item has a badge.

props.name: hasCheckbox
props.description: Flag indicating if a tree view item has a checkbox.

props.name: icon
props.description: Default icon of a tree view item.

props.name: id
props.description: ID of a tree view item.

props.name: name
props.description: Internal content of a tree view item.

props.name: title
props.description: Title of a tree view item. Only used in compact presentations.

propComponents.name: TreeViewSearch
propComponents.description:
Renders a search input for the tree view. This sub-component should be passed into the
tree view component's toolbar property.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Accessible label for the search input.

props.name: className
props.description: Classes applied to the wrapper for the search input.

props.name: id
props.description: Id for the search input.

props.name: name
props.description: Name for the search input.

props.name: onSearch
props.description: Callback for search input.

props.name: animationDuration
props.description: CSS fade transition animation duration

props.name: appendTo
props.description: The element to append the tooltip to, defaults to body

props.name: aria
props.description:
aria-labelledby or aria-describedby for tooltip.
The trigger will be cloned to add the aria attribute, and the corresponding id in the form of 'pf-tooltip-#' is added to the content container.
If you don't want that or prefer to add the aria attribute yourself on the trigger, set aria to 'none'.

props.name: aria-live
props.description:
Determines whether the tooltip is an aria-live region. If the triggerRef prop is passed in the
default behavior is 'polite' in order to ensure the tooltip contents is announced to
assistive technologies. Otherwise the default behavior is 'off'.

props.name: children
props.description:
The trigger reference element to which the Tooltip is relatively placed to.
If you cannot wrap the element with the Tooltip, you can use the triggerRef prop instead.
Usage: <Tooltip><Button>Reference</Button></Tooltip>

props.name: className
props.description: Tooltip additional class

props.name: content
props.description: Tooltip content

props.name: distance
props.description: Distance of the tooltip to its target, defaults to 15

props.name: enableFlip
props.description: If true, tries to keep the tooltip in view by flipping it if necessary

props.name: entryDelay
props.description: Delay in ms before the tooltip appears

props.name: exitDelay
props.description:
Delay in ms before the tooltip disappears, Avoid passing in a value of "0", as users should
be given ample time to move their mouse from the trigger to the tooltip content without the content
being hidden.

props.name: flipBehavior
props.description:
The desired position to flip the tooltip to if the initial position is not possible.
By setting this prop to 'flip' it attempts to flip the tooltip to the opposite side if there is no space.
You can also pass an array of positions that determines the flip order. It should contain the initial position
followed by alternative positions if that position is unavailable.
Example: Initial position is 'top'. Button with tooltip is in the top right corner. 'flipBehavior' is set to
['top', 'right', 'left']. Since there is no space to the top, it checks if right is available. There's also no
space to the right, so it finally shows the tooltip on the left.

props.name: id
props.description: id of the tooltip

props.name: isContentLeftAligned
props.description: Flag to indicate that the text content is left aligned

props.name: isVisible
props.description: value for visibility when trigger is 'manual'

props.name: maxWidth
props.description: Maximum width of the tooltip (default 18.75rem)

props.name: minWidth
props.description: Minimum width of the tooltip. If set to "trigger", the minimum width will be set to the reference element width.

props.name: onTooltipHidden
props.description: Callback when tooltip's hide transition has finished executing

props.name: position
props.description:
Tooltip position. Note: With 'enableFlip' set to true,
it will change the position if there is not enough space for the starting position.
The behavior of where it flips to can be controlled through the flipBehavior prop.
The 'auto' position chooses the side with the most space.
The 'auto' position requires the 'enableFlip' prop to be true.

props.name: trigger
props.description:
Tooltip trigger: click, mouseenter, focus, manual
Set to manual to trigger tooltip programmatically (through the isVisible prop)

props.name: triggerRef
props.description:
The trigger reference element to which the Tooltip is relatively placed to.
If you can wrap the element with the Tooltip, you can use the children prop instead, or both props together.
When passed along with the trigger prop, the div element that wraps the trigger will be removed.
Usage: <Tooltip triggerRef={() => document.getElementById('reference-element')} />

props.name: zIndex
props.description: z-index of the tooltip

props.name: children
props.description:
Displays custom content inside the timestamp, such as a relative time. This prop will
override the default content that is displayed. Custom content will not be affected by
any props that format or add to displayed content.

props.name: className
props.description: Class to add to the outer span.

props.name: customFormat
props.description:
Applies custom formatting to the displayed date and/or time. Passing this prop in will
override the dateFormat and timeFormat props.

props.name: date
props.description:
Determines the default content that is displayed inside the timestamp and the value of
the inner time element's datetime attribute.

props.name: dateFormat
displaySuffix
props.description:
Applies a custom suffix to the displayed content, usually after the time, such as a
custom time zone.

props.name: is12Hour
props.description:
Flag for displaying the time in a 12 hour format. If this prop is not passed in,
the hour format will be based on the locale prop's value.

props.name: locale
props.description:
Determines which locale to use in the displayed content. Defaults to the current locale
when this prop is not passed in. For more information about locale's:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl#Locale_identification_and_negotiation

props.name: timeFormat
props.description:
Determines the format of the displayed time in the timestamp and UTC tooltip. Examples:
"Full" => 11:25:00 AM Eastern Daylight Time
"Long" => 11:25:00 AM EDT
"Medium" => 11:25:00 AM
"Short" => 11:25 AM

props.name: isAriaMultiselectable
props.description: Indicates to assistive technologies whether more than one item can be selected for a non-checkbox select

props.name: badge
props.description: Optional badge rendered inside the toggle, after the children content

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the toggle

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the toggle

props.name: icon
props.description:
Optional icon or image rendered inside the toggle, before the children content. It is
recommended to wrap most basic icons in our icon component.

props.name: isDisabled
props.description: Flag indicating the toggle is disabled

props.name: isExpanded
props.description: Flag indicating the toggle has expanded styling

props.name: isFullHeight
props.description: Flag indicating the toggle is full height

props.name: isFullWidth
props.description: Flag indicating the toggle takes up the full width of its parent

props.name: ouiaId
props.description: Value to overwrite the randomly generated data-ouia-component-id. It will always target the toggle button.

props.name: ouiaSafe
props.description: Set the value of data-ouia-safe. Only set to true when the component is in a static state, i.e. no animations are occurring. At all other times, this value must be false.

props.name: size
props.description: Adds styling which affects the size of the menu toggle

props.name: splitButtonOptions
props.description: Object used to configure a split button menu toggle

props.name: status
props.description: Status styles of the menu toggle

props.name: statusIcon
props.description: Overrides the status icon

props.name: variant
props.description: Variant styles of the menu toggle

props.name: toggleNode
props.description: Select toggle node.

props.name: toggleRef
props.description: Reference to the toggle.

props.name: appendTo
direction
props.description: Vertical direction of the popper. If enableFlip is set to true, this will set the initial direction before the popper flips.

props.name: enableFlip
props.description: Enable to flip the popper when it reaches the boundary

props.name: maxWidth
props.description: Maximum width of the popper. If the value is "trigger", it will set the max width to the select toggle's width

props.name: minWidth
props.description: Minimum width of the popper. If the value is "trigger", it will set the min width to the select toggle's width

props.name: position
props.description: Horizontal position of the popper

props.name: preventOverflow
props.description: Flag to prevent the popper from overflowing its container and becoming partially obscured.

props.name: width
props.description: Custom width of the popper. If the value is "trigger", it will set the width to the select toggle's width

props.name: advancedSearchDelimiter
props.description:
Delimiter in the query string for pairing attributes with search values.
Required whenever attributes are passed as props.

props.name: attributes
props.description: Array of attribute values used for dynamically generated advanced search.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the advanced search menu.

props.name: getAttrValueMap
props.description: Function which builds an attribute-value map by parsing the value in the search input.

props.name: hasWordsAttrLabel
props.description: Attribute label for strings unassociated with one of the provided listed attributes.

props.name: isSearchMenuOpen
props.description: Flag for toggling the open/close state of the advanced search menu.

props.name: onChange
props.description: A callback for when the input value changes.

props.name: onClear
props.description: A callback for when the user clicks the clear button.

props.name: onSearch
props.description: A callback for when the search button is clicked.

props.name: onToggleAdvancedMenu
props.description: A callback for when the open advanced search button is clicked.

props.name: parentInputRef
props.description: Ref of the input element within the search input.

props.name: parentRef
props.description: Ref of the div wrapping the whole search input.

props.name: resetButtonLabel
props.description: Label for the button which resets the advanced search form and clears the search input.

props.name: submitSearchButtonLabel
props.description: Label for the button which calls the onSearch event handler.

props.name: value
props.description: Value of the search input.

propComponents.name: SearchInputSearchAttribute
propComponents.description:
Properties for adding search attributes to an advanced search input. These properties must
be passed in as an object within an array to the search input component's attribute properrty.

props.name: attr
props.description:
The search attribute's value to be provided in the search input's query string.
It should have no spaces and be unique for every attribute.

props.name: display
props.description:
The search attribute's display name. It is used to label the field in the advanced
search menu.

propComponents.name: SearchInputExpandable
propComponents.description:
Properties for creating an expandable search input. These properties should be passed into
the search input component's expandableInput property.

props.name: isExpanded
props.description: Flag to indicate if the search input is expanded.

props.name: onToggleExpand
props.description: Callback function to toggle the expandable search input.

props.name: toggleAriaLabel
props.description: An accessible label for the expandable search input toggle.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Aria label for the radio.

props.name: body
props.description: Body of the radio.

props.name: checked
props.description: Flag to show if the radio is checked.

props.name: className
props.description:
Additional classes added to the radio wrapper. This wrapper will be div element by default. It will be a label element if
isLabelWrapped is true, or it can be overridden by any element specified in the component prop.

props.name: component
props.description: Sets the radio wrapper component to render. Defaults to "div". If set to "label", behaves the same as if isLabelWrapped prop was specified.

props.name: description
props.description: Description text of the radio.

props.name: id
props.description: Id of the radio.

props.name: inputClassName
props.description: Additional classes added to the radio input.

props.name: isChecked
props.description: Flag to show if the radio is checked.

props.name: isDisabled
props.description: Flag to show if the radio is disabled.

props.name: isLabelWrapped
props.description: Flag to indicate whether the radio wrapper element is a native label element for the radio input. Will not apply if a component prop (with a value other than a "label") is specified.

props.name: isValid
props.description: Flag to show if the radio selection is valid or invalid.

props.name: label
props.description: Label text of the radio.

props.name: labelPosition
props.description: Sets the position of the label. Defaults to 'end' (after the radio input).

props.name: name
props.description: Name for group of radios

props.name: onChange
props.description: A callback for when the radio selection changes.

props.name: ouiaId
props.description: Value to overwrite the randomly generated data-ouia-component-id.

props.name: ouiaSafe
props.description: Set the value of data-ouia-safe. Only set to true when the component is in a static state, i.e. no animations are occurring. At all other times, this value must be false.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Adds an accessible label to the progress stepper.

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the progress stepper.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes applied to the progress stepper container.

props.name: isCenterAligned
props.description: Flag indicating the progress stepper should be centered.

props.name: isCompact
props.description: Flag indicating the progress stepper should be rendered compactly.

props.name: isVertical
props.description: Flag indicating the progress stepper has a vertical layout.

props.name: aria-label
props.description:
Accessible label for the progress step. Should communicate all information being communicated by the progress
step's icon, including the variant and the completed status.

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the progress step.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes applied to the progress step container.

props.name: description
props.description: Description text of a progress step.

props.name: icon
props.description: Custom icon of a progress step. Will override default icons provided by the variant.

props.name: isCurrent
props.description: Flag indicating the progress step is the current step.

props.name: popoverRender
props.description: Forwards the step ref to rendered function.  Use this prop to add a popover to the step.

props.name: titleId
props.description: ID of the title of the progress step.

props.name: variant
props.description: Variant of the progress step. Each variant has a default icon.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Adds accessible text to the ProgressBar. Required when title not used and there is not any label associated with the progress bar

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description: Associates the ProgressBar with it's label for accessibility purposes. Required when title not used

props.name: className
props.description: Classname for progress component.

props.name: helperText
props.description:
Content which can be used to convey additional information about the progress component.
We recommend the helper text component as it was designed for this purpose.

props.name: id
props.description: DOM id for progress component.

props.name: isTitleTruncated
props.description: Indicate whether to truncate the string title

props.name: label
props.description: Text description of current progress value to display instead of percentage.

props.name: max
props.description: Maximum value of progress.

props.name: measureLocation
props.description: Where the measure percent will be located.

props.name: min
props.description: Minimal value of progress.

props.name: size
props.description: Size variant of progress.

props.name: title
props.description: Title above progress. The isTitleTruncated property will only affect string titles. Node title truncation must be handled manually.

props.name: tooltipPosition
props.description: Position of the tooltip which is displayed if title is truncated

props.name: value
props.description: Actual value of progress.

props.name: valueText
props.description: Accessible text description of current progress value, for when value is not a percentage. Use with label.

props.name: variant
props.description: Status variant of progress.

propComponents.name: Popover
propComponents.description:
The main popover component. The following properties can also be passed into another component
that has a property specifically for passing in popover properties.

props.name: alertSeverityScreenReaderText
props.description:
Text announced by screen reader when alert severity variant is set to indicate
severity level.

props.name: alertSeverityVariant
props.description:
Severity variants for an alert popover. This modifies the color of the header to
match the severity.

props.name: animationDuration
props.description: The duration of the CSS fade transition animation.

props.name: appendTo
props.description: The element to append the popover to. Defaults to "inline".

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Accessible label for the popover, required when header is not present.

props.name: bodyContent
props.description:
Body content of the popover. If you want to close the popover after an action within the
body content, you can use the isVisible prop for manual control, or you can provide a
function which will receive a callback as an argument to hide the popover, i.e.
bodyContent={hide => <Button onClick={() => hide()}>Close</Button>}

props.name: children
props.description:
The trigger reference element to which the popover is relatively placed to. If you cannot wrap
the element with the Popover, you can use the triggerRef prop instead.
Usage: <Popover><Button>Reference</Button></Popover>

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the popover.

props.name: closeBtnAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label for the close button.

props.name: distance
props.description: Distance of the popover to its target. Defaults to 25.

props.name: elementToFocus
props.description:
The element to focus when the popover becomes visible. By default the first
focusable element will receive focus.

props.name: enableFlip
props.description:
If true, tries to keep the popover in view by flipping it if necessary.
If the position is set to 'auto', this prop is ignored.

props.name: flipBehavior
props.description:
The desired position to flip the popover to if the initial position is not possible.
By setting this prop to 'flip' it attempts to flip the popover to the opposite side if
there is no space.
You can also pass an array of positions that determines the flip order. It should contain
the initial position followed by alternative positions if that position is unavailable.
Example: Initial position is 'top'. Button with popover is in the top right corner.
'flipBehavior' is set to ['top', 'right', 'left']. Since there is no space to the top, it
checks if right is available. There's also no space to the right, so it finally shows the
popover on the left.

props.name: footerContent
props.description:
Footer content of the popover. If you want to close the popover after an action within the
footer content, you can use the isVisible prop for manual control, or you can provide a
function which will receive a callback as an argument to hide the popover, i.e.
footerContent={hide => <Button onClick={() => hide()}>Close</Button>}

props.name: hasAutoWidth
props.description: Removes fixed-width and allows width to be defined by contents.

props.name: hasNoPadding
props.description: Allows content to touch edges of popover container.

props.name: headerComponent
props.description: Sets the heading level to use for the popover header. Defaults to h6.

props.name: headerContent
props.description:
Simple header content to be placed within a title. If you want to close the popover after
an action within the header content, you can use the isVisible prop for manual control,
or you can provide a function which will receive a callback as an argument to hide the
popover, i.e. headerContent={hide => <Button onClick={() => hide()}>Close</Button>}

props.name: headerIcon
props.description: Icon to be displayed in the popover header. *

props.name: hideOnOutsideClick
props.description:
Hides the popover when a click occurs outside (only works if isVisible is not controlled
by the user).

props.name: id
props.description: Id used as part of the various popover elements (popover-${id}-header/body/footer).

props.name: isVisible
props.description:
True to show the popover programmatically. Used in conjunction with the shouldClose prop.
By default, the popover child element handles click events automatically. If you want to
control this programmatically, the popover will not auto-close if the close button is
clicked, the escape key is used, or if a click occurs outside the popover. Instead, the
consumer is responsible for closing the popover themselves by adding a callback listener
for the shouldClose prop.

props.name: maxWidth
props.description: Maximum width of the popover (default 18.75rem).

props.name: minWidth
props.description: Minimum width of the popover (default 6.25rem).

props.name: onHidden
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover has fully transitioned out.

props.name: onHide
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover begins to transition out.

props.name: onMount
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover has been mounted to the DOM.

props.name: onShow
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover begins to transition in.

props.name: onShown
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover has fully transitioned in.

props.name: position
props.description:
Popover position. Note: With the enableFlip property set to true, it will change the
position if there is not enough space for the starting position. The behavior of where it
flips to can be controlled through the flipBehavior property.

props.name: shouldClose
props.description:
Callback function that is only invoked when isVisible is also controlled. Called when the
popover close button is clicked, the enter key was used on it, or the escape key is used.

props.name: shouldOpen
props.description:
Callback function that is only invoked when isVisible is also controlled. Called when the
enter key is used on the focused trigger.

props.name: showClose
props.description: Flag indicating whether the close button should be shown.

props.name: triggerAction
props.description: Sets an interaction to open popover, defaults to "click"

props.name: triggerRef
props.description:
The trigger reference element to which the popover is relatively placed to. If you can wrap the
element with the popover, you can use the children prop instead, or both props together.
When passed along with the trigger prop, the div element that wraps the trigger will be removed.
Usage: <Popover triggerRef={() => document.getElementById('reference-element')} />

props.name: withFocusTrap
props.description: Whether to trap focus in the popover.

props.name: zIndex
props.description: The z-index of the popover.

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the panel

props.name: className
props.description: Class to add to outer div

props.name: isScrollable
props.description: Flag to add scrollable styling to the panel

props.name: variant
props.description: Adds panel variant styles

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the panel main div

props.name: className
props.description: Class to add to outer div

props.name: maxHeight
props.description: Max height of the panel main div as a string with the value and unit

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the panel main body div

props.name: className
props.description: Class to add to outer div

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the panel header

props.name: className
props.description: Class to add to outer div

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the panel footer

props.name: className
props.description: Class to add to outer div

propComponents.name: Pagination
propComponents.description: The main pagination component.

props.name: children
props.description: What should be rendered inside the pagination.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes for the pagination container.

props.name: dropDirection
props.description: Direction of dropdown context menu.

props.name: firstPage
props.description: Page to start at.

props.name: inset
props.description: Insets at various breakpoints.

props.name: isCompact
props.description: Flag indicating if pagination is compact.

props.name: isDisabled
props.description: Flag indicating if pagination is disabled.

props.name: isLastFullPageShown
props.description:
Indicate whether to show last full page of results when user selects perPage value
greater than remaining rows.

props.name: isStatic
props.description: Flag indicating if pagination should not be sticky on mobile.

props.name: isSticky
props.description: Flag indicating if pagination should stick to its position (based on variant).

props.name: itemCount
props.description: Total number of items.

props.name: itemsEnd
props.description: Last index of items on current page.

props.name: itemsStart
props.description: First index of items on current page.

props.name: menuAppendTo
props.description: The container to append the pagination options menu to.

props.name: offset
props.description: Start index of rows to display, used in place of providing page.

props.name: onFirstClick
props.description: Function called when user clicks on navigate to first page.

props.name: onLastClick
props.description: Function called when user clicks on navigate to last page.

props.name: onNextClick
props.description: Function called when user clicks on navigate to next page.

props.name: onPageInput
props.description: Function called when user inputs page number.

props.name: onPerPageSelect
props.type:
(
  event: React.MouseEvent | React.KeyboardEvent | MouseEvent,
  newPerPage: number,
  newPage: number,
  startIdx?: number,
  endIdx?: number
) => void
props.description: Function called when user selects number of items per page.

props.name: onPreviousClick
props.description: Function called when user clicks on navigate to previous page.

props.name: onSetPage
props.type:
(
  event: React.MouseEvent | React.KeyboardEvent | MouseEvent,
  newPage: number,
  perPage?: number,
  startIdx?: number,
  endIdx?: number
) => void
props.description: Function called when user sets page.

props.name: ouiaId
props.description: Value to overwrite the randomly generated data-ouia-component-id.

props.name: ouiaSafe
props.description: Set the value of data-ouia-safe. Only set to true when the component is in a static state, i.e. no animations are occurring. At all other times, this value must be false.

props.name: page
props.description: Current page number.

props.name: perPage
props.description: Number of items per page.

props.name: perPageOptions
props.description: Array of the number of items per page options.

props.name: titles
props.description: Object with titles to display in pagination.
props.defaultValue:
{
  items: '',
  page: '',
  pages: '',
  itemsPerPage: 'Items per page',
  perPageSuffix: 'per page',
  toFirstPageAriaLabel: 'Go to first page',
  toPreviousPageAriaLabel: 'Go to previous page',
  toLastPageAriaLabel: 'Go to last page',
  toNextPageAriaLabel: 'Go to next page',
  optionsToggleAriaLabel: '',
  currPageAriaLabel: 'Current page',
  paginationAriaLabel: 'Pagination',
  ofWord: 'of'
}

props.name: toggleTemplate
props.description:
This will be shown in pagination toggle span. You can use firstIndex, lastIndex,
itemCount, itemsTitle, and/or ofWord props.

props.name: usePageInsets
props.description: Flag indicating that pagination should use page insets.

props.name: variant
props.description: Position where pagination is rendered.

props.name: widgetId
props.description: Id to ideintify widget on page.

propComponents.name: PaginationTitles
propComponents.description:
Properties to customize various pagination titles. The following properties should be
passed into the pagination component's title property.

props.name: currPageAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label for the input displaying the current page.

props.name: items
props.description: The type or title of the items being paginated.

props.name: itemsPerPage
props.description: The title of the pagination options menu.

props.name: ofWord
props.description: Label for the English word "of".

props.name: optionsToggleAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label for the options toggle.

props.name: page
props.description: The title of a page displayed beside the page number.

props.name: pages
props.description: The title of a page displayed beside the page number (plural form).

props.name: paginationAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label for the pagination component.

props.name: perPageSuffix
props.description: The suffix to be displayed after each option on the options menu dropdown.

props.name: toFirstPageAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label for the button which moves to the first page.

props.name: toLastPageAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label for the button which moves to the last page.

props.name: toNextPageAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label for the button which moves to the next page.

props.name: toPreviousPageAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label for the button which moves to the previous page.

propComponents.name: PerPageOptions
propComponents.description:
Properties to customize the content and behavior of the pagination dropdown options. These
properties should be passed into the pagination component's perPageOptions property.

props.name: title
props.description: The text title of the option, which is rendered inside the pagination dropdown menu.

props.name: value
props.description: The value of the option, which determines how many items are displayed per page.

propComponents.name: PaginationToggleTemplateProps
propComponents.description:
Allows more customization of the pagination dropdown toggle. The following properties
should be passed into the pagination component's toggleTemplate property.

props.name: firstIndex
props.description: The first index of the items being paginated

props.name: itemCount
props.description: The total number of items being paginated

props.name: itemsTitle
props.description: The type or title of the items being paginated

props.name: lastIndex
props.description: The last index of the items being paginated

props.name: ofWord
props.description: The word that joins the index and itemCount/itemsTitle

props.name: additionalGroupedContent
props.description: Additional content of the group

props.name: banner
props.description: Banner component for the page. This will be rendered above a breadcrumb if one is also passed.

props.name: breadcrumb
props.description: Breadcrumb component for the page

props.name: breadcrumbProps
props.description: Additional props of the breadcrumb

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the main section of the page layout (e.g. <PageSection />)

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the page layout

props.name: defaultManagedSidebarIsOpen
props.description: If true, the managed sidebar is initially open for desktop view

props.name: drawerDefaultSize
props.description: Sets default drawer size

props.name: drawerMaxSize
props.description: Sets the maximum drawer size

props.name: drawerMinSize
props.description: Sets the minimum drawer size

props.name: getBreakpoint
props.description:
The page resize observer uses the breakpoints returned from this function when adding the pf-m-breakpoint-[default|sm|md|lg|xl|2xl] class
You can override the default getBreakpoint function to return breakpoints at different sizes than the default
You can view the default getBreakpoint function here:
https://github.com/patternfly/patternfly-react/blob/main/packages/react-core/src/helpers/util.ts

props.name: getVerticalBreakpoint
props.description:
The page resize observer uses the breakpoints returned from this function when adding the pf-m-breakpoint-[default|sm|md|lg|xl|2xl] class
You can override the default getVerticalBreakpoint function to return breakpoints at different sizes than the default
You can view the default getVerticalBreakpoint function here:
https://github.com/patternfly/patternfly-react/blob/main/packages/react-core/src/helpers/util.ts

props.name: groupProps
props.description: Additional props of the group

props.name: horizontalSubnav
props.description: Horizontal sub navigation component for the page

props.name: isBreadcrumbGrouped
props.description: Flag indicating if the breadcrumb should be in a group

props.name: isBreadcrumbWidthLimited
props.description: Flag indicating if breadcrumb width should be limited

props.name: isContentFilled
props.description: Enables children to fill the available vertical space. Child page sections or groups that should fill should be passed the isFilled property.

props.name: isHorizontalSubnavGrouped
props.description: Flag indicating if the horizontal sub navigation should be in a group

props.name: isHorizontalSubnavWidthLimited
props.description: Flag indicating if horizontal sub navigation width should be limited

props.name: isManagedSidebar
props.description:
If true, manages the sidebar open/close state and there is no need to pass the isSidebarOpen boolean into
the sidebar component or add a callback onSidebarToggle function into the Masthead component

props.name: isNotificationDrawerExpanded
props.description: Flag indicating Notification drawer in expanded

props.name: mainAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label, can be used to name main section

props.name: mainComponent
props.description: HTML component used as main component of the page. Defaults to 'main', only pass in 'div' if another 'main' element already exists.

props.name: mainContainerId
props.description: an id to use for the [role="main"] element

props.name: mainTabIndex
props.description: tabIndex to use for the [role="main"] element, null to unset it

props.name: masthead
props.description: Masthead component (e.g. <Masthead />)

props.name: notificationDrawer
props.description: Notification drawer component for an optional notification drawer (e.g. <NotificationDrawer />)

props.name: onNotificationDrawerExpand
props.description: Callback when notification drawer panel is finished expanding.

props.name: onPageResize
props.type: ((event: MouseEvent | TouchEvent | React.KeyboardEvent, object: any) => void) | null
props.description:
Can add callback to be notified when resize occurs, for example to set the sidebar isSidebarOpen prop to false for a width < 768px
Returns object { mobileView: boolean, windowSize: number }

props.name: role
props.description: Sets the value for role on the <main> element

props.name: sidebar
props.description: Sidebar component for a side nav (e.g. <PageSidebar />)

props.name: skipToContent
props.description: Skip to content component for the page

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the page sidebar (e.g. <PageSidebarBody />

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the page sidebar

props.name: id
props.description: Sidebar id

props.name: isManagedSidebar
props.description:
If true, manages the sidebar open/close state and there is no need to pass the isSidebarOpen boolean into
the sidebar component or add a callback onSidebarToggle function into the Masthead component

props.name: isSidebarOpen
props.description: Programmatically manage if the sidebar is shown, if isManagedSidebar is set to true in the Page component, this prop is managed

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the page sidebar body

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the page sidebar body

props.name: isContextSelector
props.description: Flag indicating that the page sidebar body is for a context selector/perspective switcher

props.name: isFilled
props.description: Flag indicating that the page sidebar body should fill the available vertical space.

props.name: usePageInsets
props.description: Flag indicating that the page sidebar body should use page insets.

props.name: aria-label
props.description:
Adds an accessible name to the page section. Required when the hasOverflowScroll prop is set to true.

props.name: ouiaSafe
props.description: Set the value of data-ouia-safe. Only set to true when the component is in a static state, i.e. no animations are occurring. At all other times, this value must be false.

props.name: parentMenu
props.description: ID of parent menu for drilldown menus

props.name: role
props.description:
Determines the accessible role of the menu. For a non-checkbox menu that can have
one or more items selected, pass in "listbox".

props.name: selected
props.description: Single itemId for single select menus, or array of itemIds for multi select. You can also specify isSelected on the MenuItem.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Adds an accessible name to the menu.

props.name: children
props.description: Anything that can be rendered inside of menu list

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the menu list

props.name: isAriaMultiselectable
props.description:
Indicates to assistive technologies whether more than one item can be selected
for a non-checkbox menu. Only applies when the menu's role is "listbox".

props.name: actions
props.description: Render item with one or more actions

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Adds an accessible name to the menu item.

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the menu list item.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the menu list item

props.name: component

props.name: description

props.name: download

props.name: drilldownMenu

props.name: icon

Render an external link icon on focus or hover, and set the link's

props.name: isFavorited

props.name: isLoadButton

props.name: rel
props.description: Navigation link relationship. Only set when the to property is present.

props.name: target
props.description: Navigation link target. Only set when the to property is present. If isExternalLink is also passed in, this property will be set to "_blank".

props.name: to
props.description: Target navigation link. Should not be used if the flyout prop is defined.

propComponents.name: MenuContainer
propComponents.description: Container that links a menu and menu toggle together, to handle basic keyboard input and control the opening and closing of a menu.

props.name: isOpen
props.description: Flag to indicate if menu is opened.

props.name: menu
props.description: Menu to be rendered

props.name: menuRef
props.description: Reference to the menu

props.name: onOpenChange
props.description:
Callback to change the open state of the menu.
Triggered by clicking outside of the menu, or by pressing any keys specificed in onOpenChangeKeys.

props.name: onOpenChangeKeys
props.description: Keys that trigger onOpenChange, defaults to tab and escape. It is highly recommended to include Escape in the array, while Tab may be omitted if the menu contains non-menu items that are focusable.

props.name: popperProps
props.description: Additional properties to pass to the Popper

props.name: shouldFocusFirstItemOnOpen
props.description: Flag indicating the first menu item should be focused after opening the dropdown.

props.name: toggle
props.description: Toggle to be rendered

props.name: toggleRef
props.description: Reference to the toggle

props.name: zIndex
props.description: z-index of the dropdown menu

props.name: direction
props.description: Vertical direction of the popper. If enableFlip is set to true, this will set the initial direction before the popper flips.

props.name: enableFlip
props.description: Enable to flip the popper when it reaches the boundary

props.name: maxWidth
props.description: Maximum width of the popper. If the value is "trigger", it will set the max width to the dropdown toggle's width

props.name: minWidth
props.description: Minimum width of the popper. If the value is "trigger", it will set the min width to the dropdown toggle's width

props.name: position
props.description: Horizontal position of the popper

props.name: preventOverflow
props.description: Flag to prevent the popper from overflowing its container and becoming partially obscured.

props.name: width
props.description: Custom width of the popper. If the value is "trigger", it will set the width to the dropdown toggle's width

props.name: animationDuration
props.description: CSS fade transition animation duration

props.name: appendTo
props.description: The element to append the tooltip to, defaults to body

props.name: aria
props.description:
aria-labelledby or aria-describedby for tooltip.
The trigger will be cloned to add the aria attribute, and the corresponding id in the form of 'pf-tooltip-#' is added to the content container.
If you don't want that or prefer to add the aria attribute yourself on the trigger, set aria to 'none'.

props.name: children
props.description:
The trigger reference element to which the Tooltip is relatively placed to.
If you cannot wrap the element with the Tooltip, you can use the triggerRef prop instead.
Usage: <Tooltip><Button>Reference</Button></Tooltip>

props.name: className
props.description: Tooltip additional class

props.name: content
props.description: Tooltip content

props.name: distance
props.description: Distance of the tooltip to its target, defaults to 15

props.name: enableFlip
props.description: If true, tries to keep the tooltip in view by flipping it if necessary

props.name: entryDelay
props.description: Delay in ms before the tooltip appears

props.name: exitDelay
props.description:
Delay in ms before the tooltip disappears, Avoid passing in a value of "0", as users should
be given ample time to move their mouse from the trigger to the tooltip content without the content
being hidden.

props.name: flipBehavior
props.description:
The desired position to flip the tooltip to if the initial position is not possible.
By setting this prop to 'flip' it attempts to flip the tooltip to the opposite side if there is no space.
You can also pass an array of positions that determines the flip order. It should contain the initial position
followed by alternative positions if that position is unavailable.
Example: Initial position is 'top'. Button with tooltip is in the top right corner. 'flipBehavior' is set to
['top', 'right', 'left']. Since there is no space to the top, it checks if right is available. There's also no
space to the right, so it finally shows the tooltip on the left.

props.name: id
props.description: id of the tooltip

props.name: isContentLeftAligned
props.description: Flag to indicate that the text content is left aligned

props.name: isVisible
props.description: value for visibility when trigger is 'manual'

props.name: maxWidth
props.description: Maximum width of the tooltip (default 18.75rem)

props.name: minWidth
props.description: Minimum width of the tooltip. If set to "trigger", the minimum width will be set to the reference element width.

props.name: onTooltipHidden
props.description: Callback when tooltip's hide transition has finished executing

props.name: position
props.description:
Tooltip position. Note: With 'enableFlip' set to true,
it will change the position if there is not enough space for the starting position.
The behavior of where it flips to can be controlled through the flipBehavior prop.
The 'auto' position chooses the side with the most space.
The 'auto' position requires the 'enableFlip' prop to be true.

props.name: trigger
props.description:
Tooltip trigger: click, mouseenter, focus, manual
Set to manual to trigger tooltip programmatically (through the isVisible prop)

props.name: triggerRef
props.description:
The trigger reference element to which the Tooltip is relatively placed to.
If you can wrap the element with the Tooltip, you can use the children prop instead, or both props together.
When passed along with the trigger prop, the div element that wraps the trigger will be removed.
Usage: <Tooltip triggerRef={() => document.getElementById('reference-element')} />

props.name: Unknown
props.description:
Determines whether the tooltip is an aria-live region. If the triggerRef prop is passed in the
default behavior is 'polite' in order to ensure the tooltip contents is announced to
assistive technologies. Otherwise the default behavior is 'off'.

props.name: zIndex
props.description: z-index of the tooltip

If set to error, select will be modified to indicate error state.

ID of an individual field or a group of multiple fields. Required when a role of "group" or "radiogroup" is passed in.
If only one field is included, its ID attribute and this prop must be the same.

radio inputs, or pass in "group" when the form group contains multiple of any other input type.

props.name: countOptions

props.name: hasNoPadding
props.description: Applies no padding on a plain button variant. Use when plain button is placed inline with text

props.name: icon
props.description: Icon for the button. Usable by all variants except for plain.

props.name: iconPosition
props.description: Sets position of the icon. Note: "left" and "right" are deprecated. Use "start" and "end" instead

props.name: inoperableEvents

props.name: isAriaDisabled

props.name: isBlock
props.description: Adds block styling to button

props.name: isClicked

props.name: isDanger
props.description: Adds danger styling to secondary or link button variants

props.name: isDisabled
props.description: Adds disabled styling and disables the button using the disabled html attribute

props.name: isInline

props.name: isLoading

propComponents.name: Popover
propComponents.description:
The main popover component. The following properties can also be passed into another component
that has a property specifically for passing in popover properties.

props.name: alertSeverityScreenReaderText
props.description:
Text announced by screen reader when alert severity variant is set to indicate
severity level.

props.name: alertSeverityVariant
props.description:
Severity variants for an alert popover. This modifies the color of the header to
match the severity.

props.name: animationDuration
props.description: The duration of the CSS fade transition animation.

props.name: appendTo
props.description: The element to append the popover to. Defaults to "inline".

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Accessible label for the popover, required when header is not present.

props.name: bodyContent
props.description:
Body content of the popover. If you want to close the popover after an action within the
body content, you can use the isVisible prop for manual control, or you can provide a
function which will receive a callback as an argument to hide the popover, i.e.
bodyContent={hide => <Button onClick={() => hide()}>Close</Button>}

props.name: children
props.description:
The trigger reference element to which the popover is relatively placed to. If you cannot wrap
the element with the Popover, you can use the triggerRef prop instead.
Usage: <Popover><Button>Reference</Button></Popover>

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the popover.

props.name: closeBtnAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label for the close button.

props.name: distance
props.description: Distance of the popover to its target. Defaults to 25.

props.name: elementToFocus
props.description:
The element to focus when the popover becomes visible. By default the first
focusable element will receive focus.

props.name: enableFlip
props.description:
If true, tries to keep the popover in view by flipping it if necessary.
If the position is set to 'auto', this prop is ignored.

props.name: flipBehavior
props.description:
The desired position to flip the popover to if the initial position is not possible.
By setting this prop to 'flip' it attempts to flip the popover to the opposite side if
there is no space.
You can also pass an array of positions that determines the flip order. It should contain
the initial position followed by alternative positions if that position is unavailable.
Example: Initial position is 'top'. Button with popover is in the top right corner.
'flipBehavior' is set to ['top', 'right', 'left']. Since there is no space to the top, it
checks if right is available. There's also no space to the right, so it finally shows the
popover on the left.

props.name: footerContent
props.description:
Footer content of the popover. If you want to close the popover after an action within the
footer content, you can use the isVisible prop for manual control, or you can provide a
function which will receive a callback as an argument to hide the popover, i.e.
footerContent={hide => <Button onClick={() => hide()}>Close</Button>}

props.name: hasAutoWidth
props.description: Removes fixed-width and allows width to be defined by contents.

props.name: hasNoPadding
props.description: Allows content to touch edges of popover container.

props.name: headerComponent
props.description: Sets the heading level to use for the popover header. Defaults to h6.

props.name: headerContent
props.description:
Simple header content to be placed within a title. If you want to close the popover after
an action within the header content, you can use the isVisible prop for manual control,
or you can provide a function which will receive a callback as an argument to hide the
popover, i.e. headerContent={hide => <Button onClick={() => hide()}>Close</Button>}

props.name: headerIcon
props.description: Icon to be displayed in the popover header. *

props.name: hideOnOutsideClick
props.description:
Hides the popover when a click occurs outside (only works if isVisible is not controlled
by the user).

props.name: id
props.description: Id used as part of the various popover elements (popover-${id}-header/body/footer).

props.name: isVisible
props.description:
True to show the popover programmatically. Used in conjunction with the shouldClose prop.
By default, the popover child element handles click events automatically. If you want to
control this programmatically, the popover will not auto-close if the close button is
clicked, the escape key is used, or if a click occurs outside the popover. Instead, the
consumer is responsible for closing the popover themselves by adding a callback listener
for the shouldClose prop.

props.name: maxWidth
props.description: Maximum width of the popover (default 18.75rem).

props.name: minWidth
props.description: Minimum width of the popover (default 6.25rem).

props.name: onHidden
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover has fully transitioned out.

props.name: onHide
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover begins to transition out.

props.name: onMount
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover has been mounted to the DOM.

props.name: onShow
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover begins to transition in.

props.name: onShown
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover has fully transitioned in.

props.name: position
props.description:
Popover position. Note: With the enableFlip property set to true, it will change the
position if there is not enough space for the starting position. The behavior of where it
flips to can be controlled through the flipBehavior property.

props.name: shouldClose
props.description:
Callback function that is only invoked when isVisible is also controlled. Called when the
popover close button is clicked, the enter key was used on it, or the escape key is used.

props.name: shouldOpen
props.description:
Callback function that is only invoked when isVisible is also controlled. Called when the
enter key is used on the focused trigger.

props.name: showClose
props.description: Flag indicating whether the close button should be shown.

props.name: triggerAction
props.description: Sets an interaction to open popover, defaults to "click"

props.name: triggerRef
props.description:
The trigger reference element to which the popover is relatively placed to. If you can wrap the
element with the popover, you can use the children prop instead, or both props together.
When passed along with the trigger prop, the div element that wraps the trigger will be removed.
Usage: <Popover triggerRef={() => document.getElementById('reference-element')} />

props.name: withFocusTrap
props.description: Whether to trap focus in the popover.

props.name: zIndex
props.description: The z-index of the popover.

props.name: allowEditingUploadedText
props.description: Flag to allow editing of a text file's contents after it is selected from disk.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Aria-label for the text area.

props.name: browseButtonAriaDescribedby
props.description:
ID or ID's of elements that describe the browse button. Typically this should refer
to elements such as helper text when there are file restrictions.

props.name: browseButtonText
props.description: Text for the browse button.

props.name: children
props.description: Additional children to render after (or instead of) the file preview.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the file upload container element.

props.name: clearButtonText
props.description: Text for the clear button.

props.name: dropzoneProps
props.description: Optional extra props to customize react-dropzone.

props.name: filename
props.description: Value to be shown in the read-only filename field.

props.name: filenameAriaLabel
props.description: Aria-label for the read-only filename field.

props.name: filenamePlaceholder
props.description: Placeholder string to display in the empty filename field.

props.name: hideDefaultPreview
props.description:
Flag to hide the built-in preview of the file (where available). If true, you can use
the children property to render an alternate preview.

props.name: id
props.description: Unique id for the text area. Also used to generate ids for accessible labels.

props.name: isDisabled
props.description: Flag to show if the field is disabled.

props.name: isLoading
props.description: Flag to show if a file is being loaded.

props.name: isReadOnly
props.description: Flag to show if the field is read only.

props.name: isRequired
props.description: Flag to show if the field is required.

props.name: onClearClick
props.description: Clear button was clicked.

props.name: onClick
props.description:
Callback for clicking on the file upload field text area. By default, prevents a click
in the text area from opening file dialog.

props.name: onDataChange
props.description: On data changed - if type='text' or type='dataURL' and file was loaded it will call this method

props.name: onFileInputChange
props.description: Change event emitted from the hidden \<input type="file" \> field associated with the component

props.name: onReadFailed
props.type: (event: DropEvent, error: DOMException, fileHandle: File) => void
props.description: A callback for when the FileReader API fails.

props.name: onReadFinished
props.description: A callback for when a selected file finishes loading.

props.name: onReadStarted
props.description: A callback for when a selected file starts loading.

props.name: onTextChange
props.description: Text area text changed.

props.name: spinnerAriaValueText
props.description: Aria-valuetext for the loading spinner.

props.name: type
props.description:
What type of file. Determines whether 'onDataChange` is called and what is
expected by the value property (a string for 'text' and 'dataURL', or a File object otherwise.

props.name: validated
props.description:
Value to indicate if the field is modified to show that validation state.
If set to success, field will be modified to indicate valid state.
If set to error, field will be modified to indicate error state.

props.name: value
props.description: Value of the file's contents (string if text file, File object otherwise).

propComponents.name: FileUploadField
propComponents.description:
A more customizable file upload component for implementing custom logic. Drag and drop
functionality is not built in by default.

props.name: allowEditingUploadedText
props.description: Flag to allow editing of a text file's contents after it is selected from disk.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Aria-label for the text area.

props.name: browseButtonAriaDescribedby
props.description:
ID or ID's of elements that describe the browse button. Typically this should refer
to elements such as helper text when there are file restrictions.

props.name: browseButtonText
props.description: Text for the browse button.

props.name: children
props.description: Additional children to render after (or instead of) the file preview.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the file upload field container element.

props.name: clearButtonText
props.description: Text for the clear button.

props.name: containerRef
props.description: A reference object to attach to the file upload field container element.

props.name: filename
props.description: Value to be shown in the read-only filename field.

props.name: filenameAriaLabel
props.description: Aria-label for the read-only filename field.

props.name: filenamePlaceholder
props.description: Placeholder string to display in the empty filename field.
props.defaultValue: 'Drag a file here or browse to upload'

props.name: hideDefaultPreview
props.description:
Flag to hide the built-in preview of the file (where available). If true, you can use
the children property to render an alternate preview.

props.name: id
props.description: Unique id for the text area. Also used to generate ids for accessible labels.

props.name: isClearButtonDisabled
props.description: Flag to disable the clear button.

props.name: isDisabled
props.description: Flag to show if the field is disabled.

props.name: isDragActive
props.description: Flag to show if a file is being dragged over the file upload field.

props.name: isLoading
props.description: Flag to show if a file is being loaded.

props.name: isReadOnly
props.description: Flag to show if the field is read only.

props.name: isRequired
props.description: Flag to show if the field is required.

props.name: name
props.description: Name property for the text input.

props.name: onBrowseButtonClick
props.description: A callback for when the browse button is clicked.

props.name: onClearButtonClick
props.description: A callback for when the clear button is clicked.

props.name: onTextAreaBlur
props.description: Callback for when focus is lost on the text area field.

props.name: onTextAreaClick
props.description:
A callback for when the text area is clicked. Can also be set via the onClick property
of the file upload component.

props.name: onTextChange
props.description: Text area text changed.

props.name: spinnerAriaValueText
props.description: Aria-valuetext for the loading spinner.

props.name: textAreaPlaceholder
props.description: Placeholder string to display in the empty text area field.

props.name: type
props.description:
What type of file. Determines what is is expected by the value property (a string for
'text' and 'dataURL', or a File object otherwise).

props.name: validated
props.description:
Value to indicate if the field is modified to show that validation state.
If set to success, field will be modified to indicate valid state.
If set to error,  field will be modified to indicate error state.

props.name: value
props.description: Value of the file's contents (string if text file, File object otherwise).

propComponents.name: ExpandableSection
propComponents.description: The main expandable section component.

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the expandable section.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the expandable section.

props.name: contentId
props.description:
Id of the content of the expandable section. When passing in the isDetached property, this
property's value should match the contenId property of the expandable section toggle sub-component.

props.name: displaySize
props.description: Display size variant. Set to "lg" for disclosure styling.

props.name: isDetached
props.description: Indicates the expandable section has a detached toggle.

props.name: isExpanded
props.description: Flag to indicate if the content is expanded.

props.name: isIndented
props.description: Flag to indicate if the content is indented.

props.name: isWidthLimited
props.description: Flag to indicate the width of the component is limited. Set to "true" for disclosure styling.

props.name: onToggle
props.description:
Callback function to toggle the expandable section. Detached expandable sections should
use the onToggle property of the expandable section toggle sub-component.

props.name: toggleContent
props.description: React node that appears in the attached toggle in place of the toggleText property.

props.name: toggleId
props.description:
Id of the toggle of the expandable section, which provides an accessible name to the
expandable section content via the aria-labelledby attribute. When the isDetached property
is also passed in, the value of this property must match the toggleId property of the
expandable section toggle sub-component.

props.name: toggleText
props.description: Text that appears in the attached toggle.

props.name: toggleTextCollapsed
props.description:
Text that appears in the attached toggle when collapsed (will override toggleText if
both are specified; used for uncontrolled expandable with dynamic toggle text).

props.name: toggleTextExpanded
props.description:
Text that appears in the attached toggle when expanded (will override toggleText if
both are specified; used for uncontrolled expandable with dynamic toggle text).

props.name: truncateMaxLines
props.description:
Truncates the expandable content to the specified number of lines when using the
"truncate" variant.

props.name: variant
props.description:
Determines the variant of the expandable section. When passing in "truncate" as the
variant, the expandable content will be truncated after 3 lines by default.

propComponents.name: ExpandableSectionToggle
propComponents.description:
Acts as the toggle sub-component when the main expandable section component has the isDetached
property passed in. Allows for more custom control over the expandable section's toggle.

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the expandable toggle.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the expandable toggle.

props.name: contentId
props.description:
Id of the toggle's respective expandable section content. The value passed into this
property should match the contentId property of the main expandable section component.

props.name: direction
props.description: Direction the toggle arrow should point when the expandable section is expanded.

props.name: hasTruncatedContent
props.description: Flag to determine toggle styling when the expandable content is truncated.

props.name: isExpanded
props.description: Flag indicating if the expandable section is expanded.

props.name: onToggle
props.description: Callback function to toggle the expandable content.

props.name: toggleId
props.description:
Id of the toggle. The value passed into this property should match the aria-labelledby
property of the main expandable section component.

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the empty state

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the empty state

props.name: headerClassName
props.description: Additional class names to apply to the empty state header

props.name: headingLevel

props.name: icon
props.description: Empty state icon element to be rendered. Can also be a spinner component

props.name: isFullHeight
props.description: Cause component to consume the available height of its container

props.name: status
props.description: Status of the empty state, will set a default status icon and color. Icon can be overwritten using the icon prop

props.name: titleClassName
props.description: Additional classes added to the title inside empty state header

props.name: titleText
props.description: Text of the title inside empty state header, will be wrapped in headingLevel

props.name: variant
props.description: Modifies empty state max-width and sizes of icon, title and body

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the empty state body

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the empty state body

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the empty state footer

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the empty state footer

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the empty state actions

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the empty state actions

propComponents.name: DualListSelector
propComponents.description:
Acts as a container for all other DualListSelector sub-components when using a
composable dual list selector.

props.name: children
props.description: Content to be rendered in the dual list selector.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes applied to the dual list selector.

props.name: id
props.description: ID of the dual list selector.

props.name: isTree
props.description: Flag indicating if the dual list selector uses trees instead of simple lists.

propComponents.name: DualListSelectorPane
propComponents.description:
Acts as the container for a list of options that are either available or chosen,
depending on the pane type (available or chosen). A search input and other actions,
such as sorting, can also be passed into this sub-component.

props.name: actions
props.description: Actions to place above the pane.

props.name: children
props.description: A dual list selector list or dual list selector tree to be rendered in the pane.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes applied to the dual list selector pane.

props.name: id
props.description: ID of the pane.

props.name: isChosen
props.description: Flag indicating if this pane is the chosen pane.

props.name: isDisabled
props.description: Flag indicating whether the component is disabled.

props.name: listMinHeight
props.description: Minimum height of the list of options rendered in the pane. *

props.name: onSearch
props.description: Callback for search input. To be used when isSearchable is true.

props.name: searchInput
props.description: A search input placed above the list at the top of the pane, before actions.

props.name: status
props.description: Status to display above the pane.

props.name: title
props.description: Title of the pane.

propComponents.name: DualListSelectorList
propComponents.description: Acts as the container for DualListSelectorListItem sub-components.

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the dual list selector list.

propComponents.name: DualListSelectorListItem
propComponents.description:
Creates an individual option that can be selected and moved between the

Callback to allow the dropdown component to change the open state of the menu.
Triggered by clicking outside of the menu, or by pressing any keys specificed in onOpenChangeKeys.

props.description: Vertical direction of the popper. If enableFlip is set to true, this will set the initial direction before the popper flips.

props.name: enableFlip
props.description: Enable to flip the popper when it reaches the boundary

props.description: Maximum width of the popper. If the value is "trigger", it will set the max width to the dropdown toggle's width

props.name: minWidth
props.description: Minimum width of the popper. If the value is "trigger", it will set the min width to the dropdown toggle's width
