props.description: Flag indicating that the button is visible above the code editor.

props.name: onClick
props.description: Event handler for the click of the button

props.name: tooltipProps
props.description: Additional tooltip props forwarded to the Tooltip component

propComponents.name: Popover
propComponents.description:
The main popover component. The following properties can also be passed into another component
that has a property specifically for passing in popover properties.

props.name: alertSeverityScreenReaderText
props.description:
Text announced by screen reader when alert severity variant is set to indicate
severity level.

props.name: alertSeverityVariant
props.description:
Severity variants for an alert popover. This modifies the color of the header to
match the severity.

props.name: animationDuration
props.description: The duration of the CSS fade transition animation.

props.name: appendTo
props.description: The element to append the popover to. Defaults to "inline".

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Accessible label for the popover, required when header is not present.

props.name: bodyContent
props.description:
Body content of the popover. If you want to close the popover after an action within the
body content, you can use the isVisible prop for manual control, or you can provide a
function which will receive a callback as an argument to hide the popover, i.e.
bodyContent={hide => <Button onClick={() => hide()}>Close</Button>}

props.name: children
props.description:
The trigger reference element to which the popover is relatively placed to. If you cannot wrap
the element with the Popover, you can use the triggerRef prop instead.
Usage: <Popover><Button>Reference</Button></Popover>

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes added to the popover.

props.name: closeBtnAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label for the close button.

props.name: distance
props.description: Distance of the popover to its target. Defaults to 25.

props.name: elementToFocus
props.description:
The element to focus when the popover becomes visible. By default the first
focusable element will receive focus.

props.name: enableFlip
props.description:
If true, tries to keep the popover in view by flipping it if necessary.
If the position is set to 'auto', this prop is ignored.

props.name: flipBehavior
props.description:
The desired position to flip the popover to if the initial position is not possible.
By setting this prop to 'flip' it attempts to flip the popover to the opposite side if
there is no space.
You can also pass an array of positions that determines the flip order. It should contain
the initial position followed by alternative positions if that position is unavailable.
Example: Initial position is 'top'. Button with popover is in the top right corner.
'flipBehavior' is set to ['top', 'right', 'left']. Since there is no space to the top, it
checks if right is available. There's also no space to the right, so it finally shows the
popover on the left.

props.name: footerContent
props.description:
Footer content of the popover. If you want to close the popover after an action within the
footer content, you can use the isVisible prop for manual control, or you can provide a
function which will receive a callback as an argument to hide the popover, i.e.
footerContent={hide => <Button onClick={() => hide()}>Close</Button>}

props.name: hasAutoWidth
props.description: Removes fixed-width and allows width to be defined by contents.

props.name: hasNoPadding
props.description: Allows content to touch edges of popover container.

props.name: headerComponent
props.description: Sets the heading level to use for the popover header. Defaults to h6.

props.name: headerContent
props.description:
Simple header content to be placed within a title. If you want to close the popover after
an action within the header content, you can use the isVisible prop for manual control,
or you can provide a function which will receive a callback as an argument to hide the
popover, i.e. headerContent={hide => <Button onClick={() => hide()}>Close</Button>}

props.name: headerIcon
props.description: Icon to be displayed in the popover header. *

props.name: hideOnOutsideClick
props.description:
Hides the popover when a click occurs outside (only works if isVisible is not controlled
by the user).

props.name: id
props.description: Id used as part of the various popover elements (popover-${id}-header/body/footer).

props.name: isVisible
props.description:
True to show the popover programmatically. Used in conjunction with the shouldClose prop.
By default, the popover child element handles click events automatically. If you want to
control this programmatically, the popover will not auto-close if the close button is
clicked, the escape key is used, or if a click occurs outside the popover. Instead, the
consumer is responsible for closing the popover themselves by adding a callback listener
for the shouldClose prop.

props.name: maxWidth
props.description: Maximum width of the popover (default 18.75rem).

props.name: minWidth
props.description: Minimum width of the popover (default 6.25rem).

props.name: onHidden
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover has fully transitioned out.

props.name: onHide
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover begins to transition out.

props.name: onMount
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover has been mounted to the DOM.

props.name: onShow
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover begins to transition in.

props.name: onShown
props.description: Lifecycle function invoked when the popover has fully transitioned in.

props.name: position
props.description:
Popover position. Note: With the enableFlip property set to true, it will change the
position if there is not enough space for the starting position. The behavior of where it
flips to can be controlled through the flipBehavior property.

props.name: shouldClose
props.description:
Callback function that is only invoked when isVisible is also controlled. Called when the
popover close button is clicked, the enter key was used on it, or the escape key is used.

props.name: shouldOpen
props.description:
Callback function that is only invoked when isVisible is also controlled. Called when the
enter key is used on the focused trigger.

props.name: showClose
props.description: Flag indicating whether the close button should be shown.

props.name: triggerAction
props.description: Sets an interaction to open popover, defaults to "click"

props.name: triggerRef
props.description:
The trigger reference element to which the popover is relatively placed to. If you can wrap the
element with the popover, you can use the children prop instead, or both props together.
When passed along with the trigger prop, the div element that wraps the trigger will be removed.
Usage: <Popover triggerRef={() => document.getElementById('reference-element')} />

props.name: withFocusTrap
props.description: Whether to trap focus in the popover.

props.name: zIndex
props.description: The z-index of the popover.

propComponents.name: DragDropSort
propComponents.description: DragDropSortProps extends dnd-kit's props which may be viewed at https://docs.dndkit.com/api-documentation/context-provider#props.

props.name: children

Custom defined content wrapper for draggable items. By default, draggable items are wrapped in a styled div.
Intended to be a 'DataList' or 'DualListSelectorList' without children.

props.name: items

props.name: onDrag

props.name: onDrop
props.type: (event: DragDropSortDragEndEvent, items: DraggableObject[], oldIndex?: number, newIndex?: number) => void
props.description: Callback when user drops a draggable object

props.name: overlayProps
props.description: Additional classes to apply to the drag overlay

props.name: variant
props.description:
The variant determines which component wraps the draggable object.
Default variant wraps the draggable object in a div.
DataList variant wraps the draggable object in a DataListItem
DualListSelectorList variant wraps the draggable objects in a DualListSelectorListItem and a div.pf-c-dual-list-selector__item-text element

props.description: Content rendered in the draggable object

props.name: id

props.name: appendTo

propComponents.name: DualListSelectorPane
propComponents.description:
Acts as the container for a list of options that are either available or chosen,
depending on the pane type (available or chosen). A search input and other actions,
such as sorting, can also be passed into this sub-component.

props.name: actions
props.description: Actions to place above the pane.

props.name: children
props.description: A dual list selector list or dual list selector tree to be rendered in the pane.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes applied to the dual list selector pane.

props.name: id
props.description: Id of the pane.

props.name: isChosen
props.description: Flag indicating if this pane is the chosen pane.

props.name: isDisabled
props.description: Flag indicating whether the component is disabled.

props.name: listMinHeight
props.description: Minimum height of the list of options rendered in the pane. *

props.name: onSearch
props.description: Callback for search input. To be used when isSearchable is true.

props.name: searchInput
props.description: A search input placed above the list at the top of the pane, before actions.

props.name: status
props.description: Status to display above the pane.

props.name: title
props.description: Title of the pane.

propComponents.name: DualListSelectorList
propComponents.description: Acts as the container for DualListSelectorListItem sub-components.

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the dual list selector list

propComponents.name: DualListSelectorListItem
propComponents.description:
Creates an individual option that can be selected and moved between the
dual list selector panes. This is contained within the DualListSelectorList sub-component.

props.name: children
props.description: Content rendered inside the dual list selector.

props.name: className
props.description: Additional classes applied to the dual list selector.

props.name: draggableButtonAriaLabel
props.description: Accessible label for the draggable button on draggable list items

props.name: id
props.description: ID of the option.

props.name: isDisabled
props.description: Flag indicating if the dual list selector is in a disabled state

props.name: isDraggable
props.description: Flag indicating this item is draggable for reordring

props.name: isSelected
props.description: Flag indicating the list item is currently selected.

props.name: onOptionSelect
props.type: (event: React.MouseEvent | React.ChangeEvent | React.KeyboardEvent, id?: string) => void
props.description: Callback fired when an option is selected.

propComponents.name: DualListSelectorControl
propComponents.description:
Renders an individual control button for moving selected options between each
dual list selector pane.

props.description: Accessible label for the dual list selector control.

props.description: Flag indicating the control is disabled.

props.description: Callback fired when dual list selector control is selected.

props.name: tooltipContent
props.description: Content to be displayed in a tooltip on hover of control.

props.name: tooltipProps
props.description: Additional tooltip properties passed to the tooltip.

https://github.com/patternfly/patternfly/issues/3650

props.description: Enables or disables the ability to select all - this is mutually exclusive with radio button select variant

props.name: gridBreakPoint

props.name: onFavorite
props.description:
Enables favorites column
Callback triggered when a row is favorited/unfavorited

props.name: onRowEdit
props.description: Function triggered when a row's inline edit is activated. Adds a column for inline edit when present.

props.name: onSelect
props.description: Function triggered when a row's checkbox is selected. When this is used, one checkbox/radio button will be positioned in the first or second cell of a non-expandable row

props.name: onSort

props.description: Value to overwrite the randomly generated data-ouia-component-id.

props.description: Set the value of data-ouia-safe. Only set to true when the component is in a static state, i.e. no animations are occurring. At all other times, this value must be false.

props.description: Specifies the initial sorting pattern for the table - asc/desc and the index of the column to sort by
